title: what?
content:
Seriously, KeenModding is about 5% coding.... and that coding is very often cut-and-paste.

It works like this:

1) Use ModKeen to rip out all the graphics. Use your favorite paint program to change them all--create new monsters, or just do a sprite skin like you've demonstrated here. Just be sure you don't make things too large.

2) Use one of the many level editors to piece together new levels, using your changed graphics. Be sure to playtest them!

3) Use a bunch of the pre-existing patches (cut and paste) to change the text in the game around--this lets you have your own story, help info, and so on. It's a lot easier than it sounds--most of the work is you typing up what you want it to say!

4) Set up a .bat file to run your mod. This is the tiny bit of coding you'd have to do--but honestly, if you know anything about filenames, you're good.

That's it! You should really consider it. KeenModding is awesome.

title: Re: what?
content:
Only a DOS windows.
For example, click on Start Menu, Run and type the following in the text box, depending on your windows version:
- Windows 95/98/ME: command
- Windows NT/2000/XP (Vista too?): cmd

Then, click on OK. A dos-like window should appear. Then just change dir ("cd" command) to the mod's directory (i.e. "cd C:\MyMods\mod1"). Then, run Modkeen.

You might want to check the Readme I included in the package.

EDIT: o.O I meant LModKeen. I hope Andy didn't read this. [img]http://www.classicgaming.com/cc314/msgboard/emotikeen-disguised.gif[/img] ------------------------------
